newsitem.title: USA: American Precision closes Portscap purchase.
newsitem.headline: American Precision closes Portscap purchase.

text.p: American Precision Industries Inc said Tuesday it closed on its acquisition of Portescap SA from Inter Scan Holding Ltd, a privately owned Swiss holding company.
The company said the deal was valued at 67.3 million Swiss francs, or about $46.6 million.
In April, the company reported it had signed a contract to buy the company for about $26 million.
The company said the purchase price consisted of 20,000 shares of series A convertible preferred stock, 5.5 million Swiss francs cash ($3.8 million) and a $5 million exchangeable note.

American Precision said a special meeting of its shareholders is planned for the third quarter to vote on the authorization of additional shares of common stock and a new class of series B convertible preferred stock.
The company said this would accomodate the terms of the acquisition, and would be used for future capital requirements.
